post_title.text: V11: A JavaScript(ish) Engine For Building A11Y Software

post_preview_description.text: Customizable input devices, accessibility UI APIs, and interacting with screen readers often use platform-dependent and low-level programming interfaces are not well-documented. V11, a small, fast, and efficient JavaScript(ish) engine was built to power the next generation of assistive tools and services. The engine exposes accessibility tooling and programming interfaces in a language that abstracts platform-dependent requirements into a Document Object Model-inspired platform. Just like the web, it's easy to learn for beginners, and powerful enough for the most experienced developers.

post_title.text: Andrew: An Artificial Network for Digital Recording Event Windows

post_preview_description.text: A sound-object labelling machine learning model for use as an Audacity script. Uses VGGish for feature extraction and a Pytorch N-way classifier neural network for training.

siteMetadata.title: Northwestern University
siteMetadata.description: Next Generation Content Production Tools for People with Vision Impairments.
